publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3003 Mr Gil Paterson: Live Motions-That the Parliament believes that, for the purpose of good time management and the ability to keep members fully informed in a cost effective manner, the Monday Business Bulletin should be restored to its former effective condition by containing all live motions with a full list of members who have supported each motion. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3003 Live Motions (lodged on 17 April 2002) Christine Grahame*, Michael Matheson*

S1M-3003 Mr Gil Paterson: Live Motions-That the Parliament believes that, for the purpose of good time management and the ability to keep members fully informed in a cost effective manner, the Monday Business Bulletin should be restored to its former effective condition by containing all live motions with a full list of members who have supported each motion. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Michael Matheson, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3003 Live Motions (lodged on 17 April 2002) Stewart Stevenson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Colin Campbell*, Alasdair Morgan*, Dennis Canavan*, Robin Harper*, Brian Adam*
S1M-3003 Live Motions (lodged on 17 April 2002) Kay Ullrich*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-3003 Live Motions (lodged on 17 April 2002) David Mundell*
S1M-3003 Live Motions (lodged on 17 April 2002) Fergus Ewing*, Ms Sandra White*, Irene McGugan*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Linda Fabiani*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-3003 Live Motions (lodged on 17 April 2002) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Michael Russell*
S1M-3003 Live Motions (lodged on 17 April 2002) Alex Neil*
S1M-3003 Live Motions (lodged on 17 April 2002) Mr Mike Rumbles*, Ian Jenkins*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-3003 Live Motions (lodged on 17 April 2002) John Farquhar Munro*, Tavish Scott*
S1M-3003 Live Motions (lodged on 17 April 2002) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-3003 Live Motions (lodged on 17 April 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*, Phil Gallie*, Mr Brian Monteith*
